Articles.Content:
> 
> So what's everyone's first 1.0 mission going to be?

Using the new aerodynamics system and BDArmory to make the Mk 3 of my super-heavy bomber. And then an aircraft carrier that is an aircraft.

- - - Updated - - -

The HYYYYYPEEEEE is real.
Server migration? What the hell?

> 
> My first 1.0 mission will probably be a recreation of my first KSP mission. A mission to the Mun with the Mercury style capsule, Fl-400 fuel tanks, LVT-30's LVT-45's, decouplers, and winglets. Who needs an electrical system? Landing legs? Maneuver nodes? We're doing this old school. God I miss .13. First time I played KSP was the night before a Delta IV M+ (4,2) launch. I was down at the Cape with some friends. Who can believe that was a little over three years ago. Darn it squad you're making me nostalgic!

I was thinking something along those lines too, replicating something from all those years ago. Flying to Jool with a tiny probe, in my case. Ah, .18, my Astronomy class had some good days planning flights to the Mun that year.

> 
> 2 hours ago, Maxmaps tweeted this:
> 
> 
> > 
> > Off to bed. Busy day tomorrow. #KerbalCountdown turning into #KerbalLaunch
> 
> 
> So i would expect at least 12 hours till release. Maybe more.

Well, What really does that make as far as difference. 1.0 is comming. 1.0 is comming very soon. In the greater picture, what is twelve hours to two? It is almost here either way.
They must be preparing for the crush when 1.0 goes live by moving to a higher-capacity server.
On reddit max mentioned the server was migrating to handle the loads so that we could all download tomorrow.
12-ish hours to go before launch. can we make it to 300 pages?
But this is a different release. Shouldn't this one be more of a mid-night release?

> 
> But this is a different release. Shouldn't this one be more of a mid-night release?

It is always midnight--somewhere. No?
Midnight in the US now, no?

> 
> Midnight in the US now, no?

Or 1 a.m. or 2a.m. or 11a.m. the US is a big place.
Midnight in California in 26 minutes.
Midnight on the western coast (roughly).
Wow we just fired through 200. I am hoping for 1.0 wgen I get back from school.

> 
> Wow we just fired through 200. I am hoping for 1.0 wgen I get back from school.

Me too ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Here i sit, waiting for 1.0. The past two hours have been mind-numbingly slow. At least the AMA on reddit lasted me for 20 minutes...

It is currently 11:38 pm, 26/4/15 Pacific Standard Time. Hopefully it launches at midnight.

It's ok! You can always read deep scientific papers about various topics. Try this thread on the spaceflight forums:

[http://forum.nasaspaceflight.com/index.php?topic=36313.2020](http://forum.nasaspaceflight.com/index.php?topic=36313.2020)
I hope it launches by the time i got out of work.
C'mon... Its monday! Me want KSP!

> 
> C'mon... Its monday! Me want KSP!

I bet I want it more! Come on squad! HYPE!

> 
> I bet I want it more! Come on squad! HYPE!

It is safe to assume that release will be about midday-2pm cst, so it is a long wait still.

Changed my mind about first thing to build. I'm gonna build a HYPE-rocket an take it wherever i feel like, badass style.

- - - Updated - - -

Because i'm that original.

> 
> It's ok! You can always read deep scientific papers about various topics. Try this thread on the spaceflight forums:
> [http://forum.nasaspaceflight.com/index.php?topic=36313.2020](http://forum.nasaspaceflight.com/index.php?topic=36313.2020)

Thaaank you! Oh, and the servers are still migrating, so I think it's safe to assume that we'll see KSP 1.0 later today.

Slight hype.

It's already 9 in the morning for me, on a national holiday (so no work, more KSP). But it's still 2 hours after midnight in Mexico, so I won't be seeing it untill the day's almost over. . .

> 
> Thaaank you!

You are quite welcome. The more impressive fact is that for a little under a thousand dollars you can build one of these in your own house. It's a micro-controller, a magnetron, and a resonance chamber. The rest is copious quantities of solder and hot glue along with a generous heaping of duct tape.

KSP site is down, a "Server Migration" 

Or... Maybe release?

the hype is real...

EDIT: nvm ninja'd
